attributes.action: Audit every MP and Lord to check on the Cyber Security of their office
attributes.background: In the light of claims made by some MPs on twitter that they have shared their computer password with their office team we believe there is a major cyber security risk throughout the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.additional_details: We understand that the rules set out for employees in Westminster make it clear that passwords should not be disclosed to other people. However the tweets referred to above indicate that at least 2 MPs have failed to follow these rules.

attributes.action: Negotiate right for EU/UK citizens to hold a second EU passport after 2019
attributes.background: Many people who are British born EU citizens, believe they are having their citizenship summarily removed against their will.  This resentment could be easily avoided by negotiating the right for UK Citizens to hold a second EU passport after Brexit.  This would help heal the rift in the UK.

attributes.action: Increase the age that a puppy can be imported into the UK to six months.
attributes.background:
By doing so the risk to the individuals dog's health and behaviour, the risk to healthy dogs within this country will reduced hugely.  
This will tackle the illegal puppy trade as dogs will be more mature when imported and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Importing a puppy can cause great harm to the dog through the impacts it will have on its behaviour and health. This also put other dogs at risk as the puppy can be carrying diseases such as rabies and lung worm which are not found natively in the UK. 
By raising the legal age of importing it reduces these risks along with tackling the illegal puppy trade. At six months old dogs are more mature and are less likely to be sold on to unknowing members of the public.

attributes.action: Dogs under S1 DDA should automatically be entitled to interim exemption
attributes.background: The Dangerous Dogs Act (s1) prohibits ownership of certain dogs. Any dog suspected to be a banned breed it is likely to be seized by the police and kept in a police kennel. If the court finds the dog is a banned breed but it is not deemed a danger, it may be exempted (subject to restrictions).
attributes.additional_details: The police have the power to issue an interim exemption pending the courts decision. However, this is entirely at their discretion and how this is dealt with varies between forces. Where a dog is only being pursued as a result of how they look, this interim exemption should be automatic (where the restrictions can be put in place and adhered to). Spending long periods in kennels can detrimental to the welfare of a dog and the owner.

attributes.action: Push for a two-state solution with Jerusalem the capital of Palestine
attributes.background: Trump is expected to acknowledge Jerusalem being the capital of Israel and move the US embassy there. This will put the Middle-East peace process at risk along with the rights of Christians and Muslims.
attributes.additional_details: The UK must use its global influence to continue to push for a two state solution with the 1947 borders.

attributes.action: Consider legislation that guarantees every community has access to at a free ATM
attributes.background: It is a myth that an advanced society must necessarily be cashless. In Germany, a country which knows the perils of authoritarianism, more than 80% of transactions are in cash, as citizens safeguard their privacy and freedom. Even in the US, 45% of transactions are in cash.
attributes.additional_details:
Cash machines ‘to disappear within a decade’, ATM boss warns

Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2017/12/03/cash-machines-to-disappear-within-a-decade-atm-boss-warns-7129080/?ito=cbshare
Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroUK | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MetroUK

The push for a cashless society is all about greed

Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5045305/The-cynical-conspiracy-stop-using-cash.html#ixzz50LGqAJJD

attributes.action: Review eligibility date for Officers to get Long Service & Good Conduct medal.
attributes.background: I have recently discovered that Army Officer serving since 2014 will be issued with a Long Service and Good Conduct medal. I view this is a slap in the face for former Officers, such as my father, who served prior to the 2014 deadline, who is still alive, and spent 35 years in the British Army.
attributes.additional_details: I am aware of many former Officers who served full careers with the British Army and left without receiving a medal of any sort.  It would be a great honour for them to receive such an award after 15+ years of unblemished military service.  I would therefore wish for the eligibility date to be extended to those Officers who have served 15+ years since 1900, with the ability for their offspring to apply for the award.

attributes.action: Ban the use of farrowing crates in the UK
attributes.background: Farrowing crates, profoundly similar to sow crates which were banned in the UK in 1999, are long, narrow crates in which sows are contained during gestation. It's still legal to use farrowing crates in spite of them having the same implications to animal welfare as the sow/gestation crates.
attributes.additional_details: Pigs are intelligent, sentient beings and these crates deny their natural behaviours. This frustration can be displaced to damaging abnormal behaviours such as self-mutilation due to the intensive conditions. Farrowing crates severely restrict the sow's movement and deny them the instinctual urge to build a nest, worsening their frustrations. Having been made illegal in Sweden, Norway and Switzerland, we should follow this route of progression to maintain our reputation for good animal welfare.

attributes.action: Garages must provide free air & water in working order for drivers at all times.
attributes.background: Road safety requires that drivers maintain vehicles by law, yet garages charge for & / or fail to provide working air and water at petrol stations. This petition seeks a legal requirement, that all petrol stations must provide free air & water services at all times as a condition of trading.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 8459 petrol stations in the UK in 2016 (Source: Statista) The experience of many drivers nationally is that air & water services are often lacking, of poor quality, not working & / or expensive. 
Oil companies & government make profit & tax revenue from motorists. This petition seeks to ensure that drivers may be assured of the free provision of air & water services, maintained in good working order at all times, this being a condition of trading for all garages throughout the UK.

attributes.action: Create Licenses and Rules for Pet Stores to sell and abide by for Reptiles.
attributes.background: I believe Pet Stores should have to have a specialist license to be able to keep and sell reptiles as well as having frequent checks by a specialist team such as the RSPCA. Stores having the correct information will create a better understanding for owners on what is correct for these creatures.
attributes.additional_details:
Reptiles vary in what type of care they need aren't pets for the amateurs. Some need at least UVA and UVB lighting together whilst some may need alot more specialist equipment. 
Recently Pets at Home have stopped selling Reptiles due to complaints. Many Reptiles sold have became ill or mis-sold wrong information. Which had led to an large amount of unexpected vet fees; a bad environment for these reptiles.

attributes.action: Allow  frontline ambulance staff to carry CS gas / or pepper spray
attributes.background: With the increase on assaults in the nhs and both ambulance services . It would be benificial to make it optional for ambulance workers on the frontline to carry some form or procetion/self defence equipment.

attributes.action: Give children a choice of water or squash with school dinners
attributes.background: Not all children like water, I myself as an adult don't like it either. So why should a child as young as 4 be made to go all day without a drink because it's the only drink offered with school meals. My daughter being a 4 year old i think it's unfair.

attributes.action: Demand a formal independence referendum for Catalonia
attributes.background: The behaviour of the Spanish national police and Guardia Civil in relation to the Catalonian independence referendum is shocking and has no place in a Western democracy. The British government should stand with the Catalan people and demand a free and fair referendum on their independence from Spain
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/oct/01/dozens-injured-as-riot-police-storm-catalan-ref-polling-stations

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-41461032

The Spanish authorities have undertaken what amounts to a violent crackdown on people attempting to exercise their democratic right to self-determination. Even the court findings that the vote is illegal do not justify violence by police against peaceful citizens.

attributes.action: To bring back compulsory retirement age, so people can give way for others.
attributes.background: I started work in 1971 at  the age of 15, anyone approaching 60 & 65 had to retire. Work in my town was plentiful you could finish in one job and the next day you could start another if you wanted work. Work was for all people if a person had special needs they to could get paid work no bother.
attributes.additional_details: We had so many manufactures clothes, wagons, chocolates, cotton, wool, carpets, cakes, leather goods, records, coal, steel, light bulbs, engineering and mail order to name just a few. In 1970 the population was 55.66 million, today it is 65,51 an increase of over 10 million, Worldmeters report. Now most of the work as been out sourced to other countriesleaving some towns and cities with little work. We need to make way for others who have yet to experience paid work, and the same opportunities.

attributes.action: Outlaw the sale of new build properties as buy-to-let "investments"
attributes.background:
Too many new-build properties are sold as buy-to-let "investments", often at first refusal before they are even complete.  This restricts supply, keeps prices inflated, and usually keeps young people off the property ladder and in the trap of high private rents.

This should be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is facing an unprecedented housing crisis in terms of supply, cost, and the extremely high private rents.  Young people are trapped for YEARS as tenants, or living with parents, because there are precious few affordable homes in many places.

There are whole new-build housing estates and blocks of flats which are sold off in advance (often before the property is even built) and become 100% BTL empires from the very first day, not available for people to actually buy for themselves.

attributes.action: Change trespassing from a civil offence to a criminal offence.
attributes.background: More and more trespassing and trespassers are exempt from any direct police action. What follows are costly legal proceedings against trespassers to eventually evict and in some cases the trespassers return to start the whole eviction process again.
attributes.additional_details: http://dailym.ai/2h40DL0

attributes.action: Stagger school holidays - stop holiday ripoffs
attributes.background: Companies massively increase the costs of holidays and days out during school holiday times in the UK.  By staggering the school holidays to spread demand, parents and those who work in education will be able to take advantage of cheaper prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Parent risk court fines in taking their children away in term-time to benefit from cheaper deals.

Time together as a family and learning about new cultures can be beneficial for children’s development and offers a valuable education alongside lessons taught in school

This petition calls for staggering school term dates by region, i.e. so if a parent has a child in a primary school and a secondary school in the same region, their holidays will be the same.

attributes.action: Abolish "Safe Country Reviews Policy" against Refugee and HP granted people.
attributes.background:
Refugees will now take part in a Safe Return Review five years after their refugee status is granted

The review will decide if refugees are able to stay in the UK or will return to their home

Under the policy, all those who apply for settlement will be subject to a called "Safe Return Review"
attributes.additional_details:
Campaigners claim the measures would put an end to hope of stability and end any possibility of refugees being able to integrate into society

Organisations that have signed the letter include Black Lives Matter UK, the Northern Ireland Community of Refugees and Asylum Seekers, the Scottish Refugee Council, Migrant Voice, Space4U Cardiff, Manchester Migrant Solidarity. ETC

There are now facing an uncertain five years

These are troubling times, The very idea of human rights is under threat

attributes.action: Deduct any money payable under the Brexit agreement from the Foreign Aid Budget.
attributes.background: There is public opposition to our bloated foreign aid budget and also to any Brexit payment. It makes sense to mitigate the burden on taxpayers by subsidising Brexit from the Foreign Aid Budget.

attributes.action: Discuss regulating veterinary practices and the excessive fees they charge.
attributes.background:
Veterinary fees are excessive and affect the consumer in many ways. The fees also push up the pet insurance fees where many pet owners cannot afford these. 
The vets know the owners don't have the money and then charge excessively knowing the owner will pay the fees to protect their beloved pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Vets Now recently charged £140 for emergency consultation, to update the database £17 and admit the pet to hospital £200.80 then administer the medication, blood test and scan which eventually totalled £702.04. A further £700 was issued and then consulation and putting the pet to sleep costing £240. 
The total cost was £1640.84 with VAT and didn't result in saving the life of the pet as the Vet wanted more money costing over £3000. 
Ridiculous prices which need agreeing and regulating.

attributes.action: More funding for students and single parents studying Foundation Degree Courses.
attributes.background: Students and single parents especially need more funding for studying Higher Education Courses. This can prevent financial hardship. Funding can enable a student to accomplish more goals, better prospects which helps completing their course. More funding should come from Student Finance.
attributes.additional_details: There is Foundation Degree Courses but different years of studying can prevent students from getting grants and bursaries. Grants and bursaries should be available for all Foundation Degree students on different years spent studying made available from Colleges, Universities and Student Finance. Funding can help students with buying books, travel cost, driving lessons and medical cost for sick children and young adults, and saving money for a rainy day.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from having flashing lights!
attributes.background: They are blinding,distracting and at risk of causing epileptic fits.

attributes.action: Allow Walid Durani to stay permanently in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2012 Walid fled Afghanistan to the UK after his Grandfather was beheaded.  Walid was threatened with the same fate.  Since then he has been educated and completed an apprenticeship here. He was Highly Commended at the Youth Build UK awards that took place in Parliament in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
At the age of 18 the UK Government said he should be sent back to Kabul, Afghanistan. Walid has no family or support in Afghanistan and his life will certainly be danger. Kabul is an extremely dangerous place with the Foreign Office currently advising against all but essential travel & in some areas they advise against all travel.
His story has been covered by the BBC,various radio stations & newspapers.
Please help us support Walid by signing this petition. Follow us on facebook - Support Walid

attributes.action: Promote drug harm reduction information and services
attributes.background: There were 3744 drug related deaths in the UK in 2016. The government currently provides no official harm reduction information or services. 35% of the UK's population have taken drugs in their lifetime. The government needs to promote harm reduction information and provide testing services.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to promote harm reduction in the UK in the following ways: 
- Allow licenced premises to test drugs 
- Make drugs reagent kits readily available 
- Make pharmacies have reagents where drugs can be tested for free anonymously 
- Promote information on how to use drugs safely
- Promote information on what to do in an emergency situation for a friend or family member
These services will cut drug deaths and save the NHS money. Statistics about deaths and usage are from drugwise.org

attributes.action: Declare 23 June every year a national holiday - "Brexit Day".
attributes.background:
23 June 2016 was a great day in our history and our democracy. 17,410,742 people voted to - leave the biggest vote in British history for anything.

The day should be duly recognised as significant in our national calendar.

attributes.action: Scrap smart motorways and bring back permanent hard shoulders.
attributes.background: When your vehicle has issues on a motorway, you look for the relative safety of the hard shoulder. Smart motorways have removed that safety and are not smart enough to recognise lane 1 blockages quick enough. As a consequence, lives can be put at imminent risk!
attributes.additional_details:
As a HGV driver, I struggled to understand completely the concept of a smart motorway. If there was no hard shoulder to stop on, what happens next? 
The answer, after pounding the smart tarmac, is ... it isn't smart enough. It isn't quick enough to put lane restrictions/closures in place. It is in fact....a death trap! Emergency services take longer to reach an incident due to no empty lane. It doesn't work!

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from being able to withhold medicines on the grounds of beliefs
attributes.background: I’ve recently heard several women’s experiences of being withheld contraceptive medicines like the morning after pill because of pharmacists' personal beliefs.
attributes.additional_details: Through these experiences, many women are going home and worrying about possible pregnancy. In the health and social care industry, care and treatment cannot be withheld due to the personal beliefs of staff as it would be a violation of human rights. It shouldn’t be okay for pharmacists to withhold medicines from women on this basis - providing medicine and treatment for contraceptive purposes is a large role of a Pharmacist and failing to provide these is a failure in a first world country.

attributes.action: Cut the "Aid budget" to other countries and use it to help our struggling NHS
attributes.background:
Our £13 Billion Aid budget needs to be cut for our struggling NHS. 
The NHS are struggling for staff, beds and resources to keep up with the growing demand. The NHS needs to be updated; with up to date systems/policies. 
Funding needs to be put into education, new staff and a important pay rise.
attributes.additional_details:
References- 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/07/17/government-departments-struggling-spend-foreign-aid-budgets/amp/

attributes.action: To Put Mental Health medication on to the exemption list for a free prescription
attributes.background: I have been on Bipolar Medication for a while. Like others who have various mental health problems, I can't get it for free as it is not on the exemption list. However I am on this medication for the rest of my life. It should be on the list because like most medications on the list, it's for life.
attributes.additional_details: Most people I know on these medications can't get it for free and have to pay £8.70 just for the medication, however people with thyroid problems and other problems can get it for free and all their other medications for free! Why when this is a condition that we must have our tablets every day otherwise become very ill and put into hospital can we not get it? This is an issue that needs to be spoken about mental health has to be spoken up about. It's difficult going through this and getting help.

attributes.action: Stop Kim Jong Un from ever coming to the UK.
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un is becoming increasingly powerful and reckless, we can't allow a man like that in our country.

attributes.action: Eliminate financial requirement for UK citizens bringing legal spouses to the UK
attributes.background: Currently EU citizens can settle their non-EU spouses in the UK on proof of a legal marriage. For UK citizens there are additional income or capital requirements. These additional requirements discriminate against UK citizens and can prevent resettlement of their non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules for British citizens to bring non-EU spouses to the UK are forcing some to have to leave the UK or abandon their spouse. The Government should be looking after these citizens above all others. British citizens shouldn't have to face this government imposed dilemma of choosing between their spouse and their country.
 
This petition proposes the elimination of the income and capital hurdles that discriminate against UK citizens settling their legal spouses in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it a Law for ALL Councils to log/record any Deceased/Injured cats !
attributes.background: When my cat went missing 24th Nov 17, I was told by the council that they do NOT log cats found, I want a system to be made compulsory, whereby a record is kept of cats found deceased or injured. I was informed that most are thrown into garbage vehicles and treated as rubbish. THIS HAS TO STOP !
attributes.additional_details: Most owners call their local council asking if their beloved furbaby has been picked up by street cleaners/bin men etc. My local council advised me that while a few caring street cleaners will kindly take a cat to the nearest vet, most do not and heartlessly dispose of them without a thought, leaving devastated owners needlessly searching for their family pet. With the huge news at present about cruelty/mutilation towards cats, its imperative to record these pets for possible investigations.

attributes.action: Make it legal for motorcyclists to ride without a helmet on
attributes.background: In the UK it has been illegal for most to ride with a helmet on. This does not apply to certain religious groups. I think that bikers from all walks of life should get the choice if they use a helmet or not.
attributes.additional_details: When Motor Cycles (Wearing of Helmets) Regulations 1973 (S.I., 1973, No. 180) was passed, it became illegal in the UK for anyone to ride without a helmet on. This was amended by the Crash-Helmets (Religious Exemption) Act, 1976, to give some groups the ability to opt out of using them. I don't debate that they have saved lives, but a study done in the US stated that it was only a 37% decrease. Furthermore it is primarily the biker that will face the consequences, so why force them into using one.

attributes.action: Scrap Part P, someone with 5 days experience is not safe to work on electrics
attributes.background: The public are being mislead on the terminology of what makes an electrician, often employing a Part P company over and approved electrician as they believe Part P is the same as Gas Safe.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrician training
3 or 4 Years ( and must have served as apprentice)
Exams;
level 2 - 6 units consisting of practical and theory exams 
level 3  - 7 units consisting of practical and theory exams
NVQ 3 - At least 1 year served and assessed by competent electrician with evidence of all areas of electrical work
AM2 - 16.5 hour exam on practical skills and theory
Regulations - online exam 

Part P Domestic Electrical Installer training
5 Days
Exams;
40min multiple choice Exam

attributes.action: Introduce 'reading dogs' to all primary schools in England
attributes.background: Research shows that children can get very stressed with reading aloud in class. Reading to dogs is a good way of stopping children feeling scared - dogs do not make comments or tell you off for getting things wrong and they always listen. All primary schools should have access to a 'reading dog.'
attributes.additional_details:
The Kennel Club already run a 'Bark and Read' scheme https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/barkandread 
Lane, H.B. & Zavada, S.D.W. 'When reading gets ruff: canine-assisted reading' The Reading Teacher 2013, 67(2) p. 87-95

attributes.action: Make broadcasters have content warnings and signpost support for mental illness
attributes.background: While some depictions of people's battles with mental illness in the media can oftentimes be accurate representations and this should be applauded it should also be done safely taking potential risks to the viewer/listener into account by offering warnings before the programme and signposting after.
attributes.additional_details:
Great strides have been made by some TV broadcasters to raise awareness of mental illness by depicting it so accurately, and some broadcasters exemplify how such a sensitive topic should be handled.

However I have noticed how web-based broadcasters offer no warnings of content and offer no signposting after the programme. 

This is potentially dangerous and I feel strongly that people who are vulnerable should be able to enjoy these programmes but know where to find help if needed afterwards.

attributes.action: Introduce a system for immigration to the UK like Australia based on work skills
attributes.background: To enter Austrailia to live you must apply and are considered based on the contribution you can make to the country. Each applicant should be able and expected to work and priority is given to applicants who are qualified in emplyment areas which we are lacking applicants

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on Digital Books
attributes.background: Currently, Print books are exempt from VAT, whereas eBooks are subject to tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Government launched an action plan to inspire thousands more pupils to read in 2015, and that digital books are now the preferred medium for many, it makes no sense to tax youngsters whilst trying to increase readership.

If the Government are serious about tackling reading standards, scrapping the VAT on eBooks is surely one way to make a positive impact.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-action-plan-to-inspire-thousands-more-pupils-to-read

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016
attributes.background:
This act made the sale, distribution, and consumption of all psychoactive substances (with the exceptions of food, tobacco, alcohol, caffeine and poppers) illegal.
This a ridiculous piece of legislation that in no way serves public health or even law and order, and is in effect a ban on fun.
attributes.additional_details:
This legislation puts people at risk by sending these substances into the hands of criminal gangs. It also criminalises harmless drug users, putting them into contact with more dangerous offenders in prison, and increasing the already dangerously high prison population.
An evidence-based drugs policy will allow for properly safe, regulated use, and allow people who might have problems with these drugs to feel safe getting help. This law is a waste of police resources and an affront to freedom.

attributes.action: Teach domestic abuse to all children in schools
attributes.background: As a single mother of 4 daughters, I have gone through domestic abuse and I am trying to bring my daughters up to know this is wrong, and as they spend a lot of time at school I think all children, girls and boys, would benefit from this being taught at school.
attributes.additional_details:
With domestic abuse on the rise we need to educate our children that this is wrong and not to put up with it. This is the only way to stop this moving on to the next generation. 

We also need to start making parents responsible for the actions of their abusive children. We are fined if our child misses too much school

attributes.action: Stop cyclists from using mobile phones and headphones whilst in motion.
attributes.background: As a cyclist myself, it irritates me when I see other bike riders giving the rest of us a bad reputation by using mobile phones or listening to music on headphones whilst in motion. And don't get me started on ignoring traffic lights! The rules of the road need to be enforced.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test every 5 years
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down. Drivers should be required to retake their test every 5 years after they turn 65.

attributes.action: Create"National Unity Day" UK-wide bank holiday to celebrate all that unites us.
attributes.background: We believe the United Kingdom needs a day that celebrates and promotes the fabric of what our great country was built upon - Unity. With our nation more divided than ever, we need a day that will bring us together to celebrate all that we have in common.
attributes.additional_details:
For more details visit:
www.Diversify.org

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for alcoholic drinks to list all ingredients.
attributes.background:
I have a severe life threatening allergy to the artificial colourant E110 (Sunset Yellow) and nuts.

Alcoholic drinks in the UK do NOT have to list their ingredients anywhere, not on the product nor online. 

This is so unsafe for people who have allergies and could lead to preventable deaths

attributes.action: Companies must be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products
attributes.background: In my case, I have found that it is a common theme to find that "gelatine" is an ingredient to many confectionery items. This itself presents a grave concern, as I am a follower of the Islamic faith, who does not eat pork. Thus, failure to specify the type of gelatine is misleading.
attributes.additional_details: The rationale of ingredients being displayed on the back of food packaging is that we are in a position to exercise our autonomy. So, we can make an informed decision of whether or not it is something we wish to consume. This detail should be a basic requirement for all product packaging and be given the attention similar to allergy warnings. This applies to many sectors of society Muslims, Judaism, Hinduism, Sikhism and sects of Christianity. Therefore, essential in such a diverse society.

attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that “there has been no summer like it”.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign aid by half and use the £6.5 billion saved for the homeless.
attributes.background: Lets cut Foreign aid by half and use the £6.5 billion saved to get homeless people off the streets, into rehabilitation (where needed), and into houses and jobs.

attributes.action: Lest we forget! Fly Union Flag all year round to mark centenary of end of WW1
attributes.background:
Next year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to the fallen who made the ultimate sacrifice so we could be free, we believe that the Union Flag should be flown on all Government buildings for the whole year.
attributes.additional_details:
At the going down of the sun and in the morning we will remember them.
Lest we forget.

attributes.action: Waive the two child cap on tax credits for mothers working minimum 18 hours/week
attributes.background: After April 2017, no woman will be able to claim or receive any Tax credits for a third child, unless the child is born as a multiple birth or conceived as a result of a sexual assault. This approach is callous, as well as ignorant, as many women live with men that force them to get pregnant.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government deems third babies a luxury not every family has earned, though the royal’s third baby will be taken care of, courtesy of the TAXPAYER (who's being penalised the same as those who do not work at all).
As long as a woman is in paid work, she should be able to receive tax credit support.
For each child conceived, I believe 6 hours of work is ideal - e.g: 18 hours for 3 children, 24 hours for 4 children, 30 hours for 5 children.
A cap on 5 children (with the exception of one multiple birth of twins) is fair.
If a working mother falls ill or disabled as an unforseeable result, I believe her claim for tax credits should continue. However, a cap should be placed on any children following her illness, unless she is able to return back to work.
